intro: Melilotus elegans var. barcinonensis, commonly known as the Barcino narcissus, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
